meanings.definition: The outside limit of an object, area, or surface.
meanings.sent1: She sat on the edge of the bed.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to fall off the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked along the edge of the table, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: His patience was on the edge of a knife, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The sun dipped below the edge of the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: The sharp side or part of something.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally cut his finger on the edge of the paper.
meanings.sent3: The edge of the ruler played a prank by poking the student's hand.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a cutting edge that left him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The edge of the sword gleamed in the sunlight, ready for battle.

meanings.definition: A point at which something is likely to begin or happen.
meanings.sent1: We are on the edge of a new era in technology.
meanings.sent2: The team was on the edge of victory.
meanings.sent3: The edge of the weekend always brings a sense of anticipation.
meanings.sent4: She stood at the edge of decision, unsure of which path to take.
meanings.sent5: The edge of change is where growth begins to unfold.
